message: A few of the guys from the Mahalo.com dev team are heading up to StartupCraft next weekend.  This will be my first gaming tournament.  What can I expect?  Any tips for a first-timer?
Have fun :)  Make sure to remember to bring a mousepad.  last time, i remembered everything except a mousepad.

Try to stay as calm as possible and just rely on what you've practiced.  I remember after my first win (a very close call against a DT rush) I had to get up and walk out of the room because my hands were shaking so much lol.
My hands shake, too, when I play competitively in a real environment
And my APM tends to go up considerably :)
mousepad, keyboard, mouse, drivers, configuration for drivers. Seating might not be great, bring cushions. gl hf~~!
I get tense just laddering (and I'm a silver 1v1! :), I get withdrawal from not playing SC2 then I can't take it for more than an hour. Perhaps I put that on myself...
how long have you been playing?
Since 3 weeks after release? Only probably get just an hour a day though at most. Because of the short amount of time I get, I just play 4v4, far, far less stressful
Free for alls (through the multiplayer tab, not custom games) are also great fun. Always lots of banter :p

That's actually a good point.  If you lose and are out of the tourney, or if you're just idling until your next match, there are usually a lot of people who are willing to play a match.  FFA, team, whatever.  It can be a lot of fun.
@dz are you coming by for startupcraft for the side action?
I'm actually join a 2v2 with a friend in a side/fake company he owns :)
They'd better have a lot of beer.  I gotta drown my 2v2 sorrows.
Ugh, nevermind.  I'm never drinking again.
